page.title: 17PERTENHALL CHURCH
page.content: {The church}dates from Anglo-Saxon times, but the main aisle and tower were added in the 14th century. There is a fine example of an Anglo-Saxon arched doorway and some interesting mullioned windows. The church is one of six which make up the parish of Stogen Churches. There is a Rector and a part-time deaconess. Inside the church there are approximately forty pews, an organ, belfry, font, carved pulpit, and choir stalls. There is a crusader's tomb and an engraved coat of arms which dates back to the Wars of the Roses.There are two spiral staircases leading to the tower, one of which may have been used as a priest's hole in the Reformation.
